| Number of total Company Firmographics API calls | horiz_integrations_apis__num_api_calls_total_company_firmographics__by_day\n(edw.mso__pa__dt_org__metrics) | Total number of Company Firmographics API calls made by day. Also known as scribe, the Company Firmographics API (previously known as Lead Enrichment API) delivers company firmographics data for the provided people (or lead or contact) email address. The response also includes segment information. Customers need 6sense Platform or Sales Intelligence package to access this API. Not all API calls will be matched. |    |
| Number of total Company Identification API calls | horiz_integrations_apis__num_api_calls_total_company_identification__by_day\n(edw.mso__pa__dt_org__metrics) | Total number of Company Identification API calls made by day. Also known as epsilon, the Company Identification API (previously known as Company Details API) identifies anonymous website visitors by taking an IP address and matching it to an Account. Data returned from this API includes company firmographics, segments, and score data associated with that IP and company. Customers need the 6sense Platform to access this API. Not all API calls will be matched. |    |
| Number of total Company Products API calls | horiz_integrations_apis__num_api_calls_total_company_products__by_day\n(edw.mso__pa__dt_org__metrics) | Total number of Company Products API calls made by day. |    |
| Number of total Company Segments API calls | horiz_integrations_apis__num_api_calls_total_company_segments__by_day\n(edw.mso__pa__dt_org__metrics) | Total number of Company Segments API calls made by day. |    |
| Number of total Domain to Company API calls | horiz_integrations_apis__num_api_calls_total_domain_to_company__by_day\n(edw.mso__pa__dt_org__metrics) | Total number of Domain to Company API calls made by day. |    |
| Number of total Lead Scoring API calls | horiz_integrations_apis__num_api_calls_total_lead_scoring__by_day\n(edw.mso__pa__dt_org__metrics) | Total number of Lead Scoring API calls made by day.  The Lead Scoring API allows customers to update people (or lead or contact) with 6sense Predictive Scores. The API matches based on the input email address and returns account and person-level scores by product category. Customers need the 6sense Advanced Package to have access to this API. |    |
| Number of total Lead Scoring and Firmographics API calls | horiz_integrations_apis__num_api_calls_total_lead_scoring_and_firmographics__by_day\n(edw.mso__pa__dt_org__metrics) | Total number of Lead Scoring and Firmographics API calls made by day. The Lead Scoring and Firmographics API (previously known as Lead Enrichment and Scoring API) combines the API responses for Company Firmographics API and Lead Scoring API. This API is specifically designed to unlock real-time enrichment and scoring use cases from marketing automation platforms like Marketo. Not all API calls will be matched. |    |
| Number of total People Enrichment API calls | horiz_integrations_apis__num_api_calls_total_people_enrichment__by_day\n(edw.mso__pa__dt_org__metrics) | Total number of People Enrichment API calls made by day. The People Enrichment API enables customers to enrich people (or lead or contact) level data using 6sense People Enrichment API directly in their rev-tech platforms (e.g.: CRM, MAP, BI, etc.). Customers need 6sense Platform or Sales Intelligence package to access this API. Not all API calls will be matched. |    |
| Number of total People Search API calls | horiz_integrations_apis__num_api_calls_total_people_search__by_day\n(edw.mso__pa__dt_org__metrics) | Total number of People Search API calls made by day. The People Search API enables customers to easily search for people (or contacts or Leads) in an organization to find the right one. People Search API delivers the list of profiles matching an account for a given domain. Customers can narrow down their search using filters like locations, Industries & job titles. This API returns whether or not 6sense has contact information details like Email, Phone, Mobile Number. Not all API calls will be matched. |    |
| Number of total Segment ID Accounts API calls | horiz_integrations_apis__num_api_calls_total_segment_id_accounts__by_day\n(edw.mso__pa__dt_org__metrics) | Total number of Segment ID Accounts API calls made by day. |    |

The Smart Form Fill API enriches website forms with people and/or company data when a user has provided their email or is using their IP address. Not all API calls will be matched. |    |

Customer will not be charged an additional 6sense Enrichment API Credit for exporting a record via 6sense Enrichment API(s) multiple times during the current calendar month. # CORE Data {#h-9a566366}

Term: Data Champions Business Definitions - Documentation
Description: The purpose of this document is to establish a clear and standardized understanding of key business definitions. Data Champions will document critical data elements, ensuring alignment on ownership, data sources, and data definitions while applying data governance principles

\
# **Instructions** {#h-12e36352}

### **Step 1: Identify a Painful Process, Data Issue, or Work-stream** {#h-8fce88e3}

In your breakout group, discuss and select a data-related pain point in your domain. Consider the following:

* **Are there inefficiencies due to unclear data ownership or definitions?**
* **Do different teams interpret or use the same data differently?**
* **Is inaccurate or inconsistent data affecting decision-making?**

Use the table below to document your details.

| Painful Process/Data | Description of the Issue | Business Impact |
|----|----|----|
| *Example: Inconsistent ACV calculation* | *Different teams (Finance, GTM, RevOps) report on ACV differently, leading to reporting discrepancies.* | *Inconsistent ACV definitions and calculation methodology creates reporting discrepancies and impacts forecasting.* |
| GTM Segment | Different ways of reporting on Account segment and many different fields to choose from. Which data source do we use for certain deals. | Inconsistencies in downstream reporting and the misalignment in how we report out on Partnerships segment. \n\nIncreases complexity for Account routing and the sources behind employee counts |
| DPA Data Deletions (Legal) | Legal teams have to manually audit of contracts and the contract terms for data deletions do not always match up. |    |
|    |    |    |
|    |    |    |


---

### **Step 2: Apply the Producers and Consumers Framework** {#h-4d7d3abe}

Now that you've identified a pain point, think about who **creates** and **uses** this data.

| Data/Process {colwidth=301} | Producers (Who owns it?) {colwidth=269} | Consumers (Who relies on it?) {colwidth=406} | Data Products |
|----|----|----|----|
| *Example: Annual Contract Value (ACV)* | *RevOps & Finance* | *Finance, RevOps, Deal Desk, GTM, Corporate Data, etc.* | GTM Dashboards, Revenue Forecasting Reports, Board Reporting / EOY Reporting |
| GTM Segment - Account Ownership | RevOps (Ann Neir) | CS, Sales, Marketing / BDR Ops, Corporate Data, RevOps, Product, Compensation | LeanData, Salesforce, Marketo, Gainsight, 6sight reporting, Ancillary systems, 6sense products |
| GTM  Segment - Reporting | Finance (Priya Jain) | Finance, BoD, ELT | Board Reporting Reports / EOY Reports, LeanData, Salesforce, Marketo, Gainsight, 6sight reporting, Ancillary systems, 6sense products |
|    |    |    |    |


---

### **Step 3: Document the Business Definition** {#h-9a1241a1}

Define the specific data element contributing to the issue.

| Name {colwidth=159} | Business Definition {colwidth=385} | Definition Owner | Data Source | Data Definition {colwidth=444} | Governance Considerations {colwidth=436} | Links |
|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|
| *Example: Annual Contract Value (ACV)* | *ACV represents the annualized revenue expected from a contract. It normalizes contract values to a yearly basis, allowing consistent comparison across deals of varying durations.* | *RevOps  & Finance* | ***Salesforce***\*: Account, Opportunity\* | ***__Formula (Quote Object) __****\nTotal_ACV__c = (Total_SaaS_ACV__c + Total_Support_ACV__c + Total_Data_Other_ACV__c + Total_3rd_Party_SaaS_ACV__c) - Discount_ACV__c. \n\n* | *Differences in calculations for Rolling ACV, Open Renewal ACV, and Account Won All Time ACV causes inconsistency in quarterly reporting.\n\nRequires alignment between Finance and RevOps.* | [Salesforce Technical ACV TCV Build](https://atlas.6sense.com/support/solutions/articles/23000157272-Salesforce-Technical-ACV-TCV-Build) |
| GTM Segment - Sales Account Ownership | Ultimate Parent GTM segment (UP_GTM_Segment) determined for the specific Account determined by the stamped Ultimate Parent Account Owner on the Opportunity at the time of close. | *RevOps* | Salesforce, Internal Data |    | Requires alignment around employee counts when dealing with conflicting data sources (Internal vs External data sources) | [Technical Doc For Sub-Segment Stamping on Opportunity.docx](https://6sense.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/BusinessTechnology/EaGTrPNIXDRKo0XYwHZLw1gBe_AUy23hfK_-lVT-P_Az2Q?e=pWMFzn) |
| GTM Segment - CS Account Ownership | The GTM Segment uses the stamped Opportunity Owner (e.g. Role) on the Closed-Won Opportunity to define CS Ownership. | *RevOps* | Salesforce, Internal Data |    |    |    |
| GTM  Segment - Reporting |    | *RevOps & Finance* | Salesforce |    |    |    |
|    |    |    |    |    |    |    |
|    |    |    |    |    |    |    |
|    |    |    |    |    |    |    |
|    |    |    |    |    |    |    |

## **Governance Considerations Discussion Prompts** {#h-1ed32486}

* **Ownership Clarity**: Is it clear who owns and maintains this definition?
* **Data Quality**: Are there inconsistencies in how this data is captured across systems?
* **Alignment**: Do different teams interpret the same data differently?
* **Action Plan**: What steps are needed to align this definition across teams?


---

## **Expected Outcomes** {#h-1e1c28a4}

By the end of this exercise, each breakout group should have:


1. **A documented painful process or data issue** affecting their domain.
2. **A breakdown of who owns and consumes the data** related to the issue.
3. **A clearly defined and governed business definition** for a key data element.
4. **A call to action for governance** to improve data quality and alignment.

\

Term: 6sense Business Definitions - Documentation
Description: **\*\*\*\*IMPORTANT NOTE:** These are currently drafts of business definitions for 6sense based on prior conversations. Before these definitions are formal across the organization, they must be reviewed by the definition owners and translated into SQL so the organization can repeatedly use the same definitions. This NOTE will be removed when those approvals are gathered.

## Customer {#h-54e4f3a4}

THIS IS CURRENTLY EXAMPLES -- they are not written by the Definition Owners

| **Name** {colwidth=115} | **Definition** | **Definition Owner** | **Definition Sign Off?** | **Data Source** | **Formula** | **Data Definition (Link out to SQL/DBT models in future)** |
|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|
| Customer | To be considered a customer, an Account must have an ACTIVE contract for the specified period. \n\nCustomer counts should be calculated at the Ultimate Parent level of the Accounts (ie how many logos do we have). | RevOps (Ann Neir) \| Finance (Priya Jain) |    | **Salesforce**: Account, Contract |    | \*\* This does not account for the Ultimate Parent\nselect account_id , start_date , end_date\`\`from contract\`\`where _fivetran_active\`\`and status = 'Activated' and current_date BETWEEN start_date and end_date |
| Product Specific Customers | To be considered a customer of a specific product, the Account must meet the general customer definition stated above, and they must have active Product Entitlement with a value >0 for the specific product areas. | Finance (Priya Jain)\| Product (Jerome Levadoux) |    | **Salesforce**: Account, Contract, Product Entitlements\n\nThere is a known limitation of Product Entitlements not being date-specific. In the future, we should look at using the Subscription Object as a data source instead of Product Entitlements. |    |    |

## ACV {#h-dcd4f2ef}

## Deal Types {#h-4707f5c3}

| **Name** {colwidth=114} | **Definition** | **Definition Owner** | **Definition Sign Off?** {colwidth=109} | **Data Source** | **Formula** | **Data Definition** |
|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|
| Upsell | Customer purchases more of a product of which they have an active subscription, or a product which they have purchased previously. | RevOps |    | **Salesforce**: Account, Opportunity |    |    |
| Down-sell | Customer reduces ACV of an Active contract, or does not renew at the expected ACV ammount of an open renewal opp. | RevOps |    |    |    |    |
| Cross-sell | Customer co-terms the purchase of a new product to add to their active contract, which they have not purchased before. | RevOps |    | **Salesforce**: Account, Opportunity |    |    |
| Renewal | Customer agrees to continue their contract and extend the service term. New term starts the day after current contract expiration date. | RevOps |    |    |    |    |
| Early Renewal | Customer agrees to extend the service term of their agreement. Start date of the new agreement is before the current contract expiration. Prorated credit for any remaining paid invoice is applied to the cost of year one in the new contract. | RevOps |    |    |    |    |
| Attrition | Customer cancels their contract mid term, or does not renew. | RevOps |    |    |    |    |

## Segmentation {#h-79ea04da}

| **Name** | **Definition** | **Definition Owner** | **Definition Sign Off?** {colwidth=218} | **Data Source** | **Formula** | **Data Definition** |
|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|
| Go-to Market (GTM) Segment | The segment associated with an account based on the employee count | Finance |    | **Salesforce**: Account, Opportunity |    | UP GTM Segment is the SFDC field used to record this information. UP GTM Segment correctly captures EMEA, which deviates from the provided definition in that all accounts with EMEA HQs are labeled “EMEA” in UP GTM Segment (e.g. no strategic, enterprise, etc.). Additionally, partnership opportunities are not captured. “Types” with “Partner OEM…“ and “Partner Publisher"…” are “Partnership” GTM Segment. This is the segment definition used for external reporting |
| Sales Representative (Rep) Segment | The segment associated with an account based on the sales rep that sold the deal | Finance |    |    |    | The SFDC field is “Rep Segment”. This field is used for internal reporting. The field is stamped with the segment of the rep that sold the deal at the time of closing. |
| Customer Success (CS) Segment | The segment associated with an account based on the CSM that owns the account post sale | Finance |    |    |    | The CS Team segment associated with an opportunity is based on the Opportunity Owner’s (CSM) department’s VP. The field used to record this is VP Required for Approval. |
| Partnerships Segment | A manually created segment definition that captures Partnership opportunities | Finance |    |    |    | The GTM Segment definition does not capture this segment, as the size and geo of the company overrides and buckets into strategic, enterprise, etc. We override this definition using “Types” with “Partner OEM…“ and “Partner Publisher"…”. We need to exclude Partner opportunities to better understand the performance in our core business. |
| EMEA Segment | In Sales, the account is EMEA region if the parent HQ is in EMEA | Finance |    |    |    | The UP GTM Segment field is used to capture this information. If the Company HQ is in EMEA, it is tagged as EMEA segment. We use this field to externally report performance in the EMEA segment. |
| Type Bucket | Summary categorizations of opportunity types into New Business, Upsell, Attrition, Downsell, Debooking, and Renewal | Finance |    |    |    |    |
| Won, Open, Loss | The opportunity status | Finance |    |    |    | This information is captured in the “Won, Open, or Loss“ field. Depending on the reporting, we use the various statuses. e.g. when reporting any closed sales information for the prior period, we use the status “Won”. We create a slide using “loss” status and the reason to understand lost opportunities. For renewals, attrition type opportunities are “Won” in order to calculate churn. A renewal is either “open” or “won” based on whether or not the opportunity is still open/set to close or already closed. |
